solution_line_template: Jerome has {classmates_count} classmates on the list, and has half as many out of school friends on there so he has {classmates_count}/{half_divisor}=<<{classmates_count}/{half_divisor}={out_of_school_friends}>>{out_of_school_friends} out of school friends on the contact list

He has {parents_count} parents and {sister_count} sister on the contact list, for {parents_count}+{sister_count}= <<{parents_count}+{sister_count}={family_members}>>{family_members} family members on the contact list.

Adding the classmates, out of school friends and family members together we get {classmates_count}+{out_of_school_friends}+{family_members}=<<{classmates_count}+{out_of_school_friends}+{family_members}={total_people}>>{total_people} people on his contact list
